came back here and go the chow mein with orange chicken. same great meal with not as long a wait. throw in the complimentary hot and sour soup for the table and this is probably one of my favorite spots to eat!
author: omid a.

description:
This reminds me of Jade China and Wonder Wok from San Jose all in one.. very good service, quick, cheap, portions are rather plentiful, and tastes great!  

We came in on a super hot ass day.. our server was nice and kept refilling our water though she apologized that there was no ice but at least she made that extra effort.  We had the eggrolls for appetizer, a beef chow fun plate, a seafood/veggie chow mein plate, and a soda for just $20!  I think that is a pretty good ass deal.. 

Chow fun was tasty, meat was juicy, and there was enough gravy and bell peppers and black beans to cover each bite, the chow mein looked good, though I did not try it.. the eggrolls were yummy; came w/ a small plate of sweet and sour sauce.

Parking can be terrible but if you park in the Safeway/24 Hour Fitness Plaza and walk across the street then no coins needed for the meter!
author: Tram N.

description:
Fast and friendly service, lots of different items on the menu. We ordered chow fun, Mongolian beef, sesame chicken, steamed rice and pot-stickers. Every was good and the portions were pretty big. Although this isn't my regular go-to place for Chinese, I was pleased and will be back here again. 

Small family-run joint and worth a visit if you're in the area and craving Chinese.
author: L M.

description: I work in San Francisco on the weekend and I order lunch from this place some what often but that's going to end. The past two times I ordered from Jade's café the delivery person watched as I signed my receipt, the driver said "No tip"?. This happen today. After the transaction is complete the delivery person leaves the building and mutters "every time deliver no tip" not Thank you we appreciate your business. Don't tip the delivery driver he won't say Thank you or Have a nice day.
author: Rebecca W.

description: We were craving Chinese food and ended up here on a Sunday afternoon. We had the mango chicken and the seafood Hong Kong style noodles. Our meal came with complimentary tea and hot & sour soup. Service was standard but I didn't expect much to begin with, and the food was average. Wouldn't go out of the way to dine here, but wouldn't mind coming back if I'm in the area craving Chinese food.
author: Zell C.

description:
Great place to go to if you want good & quick chinese food. 

Love their crispy chicken, pan fried noodles and bbq pork chow mein. My daughter makes it a point to always get th honey walnut prawns!
author: A M.

description:
This is a great cafe for those on the run and looking for good quality food.
I have digestive problems since having been poisoned in an expensive restaurant, therefore, I am very picky about what I eat, otherwise I get unpleasant feelings. I can eat most things in this cafe, so the food is of good quality. The food is simple and to the point. So if you are a health-oriented person on the run, this place will satisfy your needs. There isn't much of a decor, but the place doesn't claim to be a restaurant...it is a cafe. The service is good, but you may need to wait a minute if there are lots of people, so be patient. People working there are real people...sometimes tired...so if they don't smile at you (some people complain here...get a life) don't take it personally, usually they will smile.
author: Sergey A.

description: Had lunch here yesterday.  The food was better than most of the chinese restaurants in the area at a valued price.  Only thing I didn't like, was the service, it was like pulling teeth trying to order food.  Waving, making eye contact while waving to the staff doesn't work.  The only person seems to take orders is the lady behind the counter.  After 7-10 of waving, she finally comes over and doesn't ever acknowledge with a sorry.  I'll probably wont return to this place.  The service really bugged me
author: Delon N.

description: If you are looking for somewhere fancy, then here is not the place. Looking for some lunch or dinner take out? Oh yes, all kinds of Chow Fun are one of the best taste in town. Another day, I noticed that lunch special rice plate are normally only fish fillet plate also very yummy, and it's only $6.5 as I remembered. geez... hard to spend $20 buck here! A must try place if anyone is in the neighborhood. :)
author: Flora F.

description:
Who'd think that a hole in the wall restaurant with no decorations and furniture that came out of a discount restaurant supply store could have good food?  Well, this is often the case.  They spent their money on the food, not on the furnishings.  

I've long liked the Jade, both the 16th and Bryant one and the long-established one in the Polk area.  

The mushu pork is excellent, the curry beef is meaty and spicy, the won tons and the kung pao chicken, you name it, they cook it fast and fresh, and deliver it for a GREAT price.  The curry beef with vegetables over rice for $6 -- who can beat that?  The Jade is a regular stop for me.
author: Chilly M.

description:
Like the previous yelper stated, this place is very Blue Collar.  You look around and you'll almost always see a lot of big dudes dining there.  

I come here for lunch, as it's close to my work.  The servers are friendly and the food comes really quick.  

If you dine-in, they serve you soup for the lunch specials.   The food they serve is pretty decent.  The portion is pretty big so I always end up taking the rest home.  Oh, and the price is pretty cheap, too.
author: Kioko O.

description: Cheap Chinese food.  I pretty much always get the chicken fried rice and it's a good portion (enough for 2 meals) and quite delish.  I guess the reviews here are saying that the food is bland and I do have to agree somewhat.  It's really nothing some soy sauce and chili oil can't fix.  And I prefer that over something overly salty.  I'm rating this place pretty generously despite some pretty major flaws.  For one, the chicken fried rice is listed at $5.50 on the menu but they always charge me $6 (actually, I  just realized that's probably tax).  I figure that's cool because they give me soup and tea with my meal.  I also don't like all the rules about minimum order for take out and credit cards.  Still, for cheap and filling lunch, it makes me happy.
author: Dan P.

description: Don't know what it is about these sisters who run this place. I must have been here over ten times, tip them well and every time I come here, I'm treated as a stranger. They hardly ever smile. The food is ok for the money but I may have to fund another chinese restaurant where my business is valued.
author: James R.

description:
Let's keep this straightforward:

I had a cheap Chinese lunch that was pretty decent. My Sesame Chicken was freshly cooked and tender.

This place won't win any points from germophobes, but I didn't feel the need to take a shower after leaving, so it's not so bad.

Overall a solid choice for the neighborhood.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Service is halfway to nonexistent. It was 85 degrees in there, but nobody came by to refill my tiny water glass. Best stick to noodle and rice dishes on the menu.

But, garlic powder dumped on top of garlic fried rice? Really?!
author: Adam Z.

description: Been coming here for over 6 years now. The food is good espically for the price and has stayed consistant. Oneof my favorite greasy chinese food places of all time. My boyfriends favorite is the Mongollian Beef. I love the Pan Fried noodles and Mango chicken. The servers can be a bit rude at times... but hey the food is still good.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Sometimes you get what you pay for. Other times you pay very little...and you get even less.

My trip to Jade was an accident. I had accidentally paid for way too much time on the parking meter and had a full 30 minutes leftover when I returned to the car. (I know! How often does THAT happen?) So I decided to pop into Jade.

Big mistake.

I ordered the duck and rice combo. It was oddly inexpensive. One bite and I knew why -- my "duck" was 90 percent bone. I gagged and spit out a chunk of bone that was nearly the size of my pinky finger. So I proceeded to separate the rest of the meat from its bony counterparts. When I was finished, I was left with a large pile of inedible bird bone and a miniscule pile of actual flesh. So I ate that in about 2 or 3 forkfuls and was then faced with nothing but boring white rice.

If you decide to eat here, stick with the veggie plates! Your easily shredded throat tissue will thank you.
author: John G.

description:
Taking advice from my fellow soup loving yelper Rita, I decided to check this place out for lunch today. I had a hankering for some wonton soup!

Word to the wise: CALL AHEAD. WAY AHEAD. I came in here planning on ordering soup to go, and this place was crankin! I mean packed at lunch time. The bulldog of a lady at the counter was no nonsense. She was so effecient taking orders, phone calls, and handling the business. The servers were flying in and out of the kitchen with giant plates of chow mein, which I then wished I ordered. So needless to say, my "to-go" order took actually like 15-20 minutes. Downside is that there's really nowhere to wait, so you kind of just get in the way. I feel like I would've gotten served more quickly if I had decided to sit and eat, because the servers were on top of it.

Anyways, after I finally get my soup and take it back to the office, all was forgiven. Packed full of wontons and barbequed pork and greens, my soup was just what I wanted. It was satisfying and tasty.

Next time I'll get smart and call it in. Or, you can get free delivery with a $10 order! My co-workers and I can team up and get it delivered! Sweet. So all in all, I can't really hate on a place for being busy; that just means they're doing something right!
author: Audrey K.

description:
Cheap is nice but not worth the $7 I have paid at Jade to put something vile into my mouth.

I've gone here twice and all I can say is take a peek into the kitchen and my review is explanatory. It's dirty. I saw one cook place a bowl on the ground as she was cutting up meat, and shucking the leftover "unacceptable" portions over the counter into the bowl. 

On top of that, ambivalent service and disgusting food (rubbery chicken that you doubt is even chicken, sauce that tastes a week old) = just don't do it.
author: Amy Z.

description:
This is a Blue Collar Chinese Restaurant. So what does that mean exactly? You ever go to a Chinese place in the Sunset or Richmond during lunch and it's full of painters or construction handymen? Well this Jade Cafe has all kinds of workers on lunch. Muni, Postal Svc, Cal Trans, construction. This place is packed during lunch. You just want to eat, enjoy it, and get full in less than 45 minutes... maybe less than 30. This is that place. 

This is not the place where you just sit and enjoy the travel log. This is pretty good food, not Panda Express. The servers know that you're watching the clock, and if they know they're ahead of schedule, they'll tell you to take your time. I found that kind of funny.

With a generous Rice Plate that comes with soup, you're out of there for $7 including tip. Scrambled eggs with beef is awesome and so is the Chicken with Tender Greens. The full order of Chicken and Broccoli has really nice presentation, and the Chow Mein is pretty good too. The won ton & noodle soups are alright. You're not going to find better Chinese food in this neighborhood, and getting to have it for lunch is awesome.

Feed the meters on the street (8min/.25) or try your luck at the mall lot across the street.

Jade Cafe #2 is COOL!
author: Rick V.

description:
let me bottom line it for you.
cheap, good tasting Chinese food.
big food portions, 
crowded during lunch time.
this means that others agree with me.
author: Jeff W.

description:
I'm giving these guys 2 stars, because I'm a frequent vistor of this restaurant. I've eaten their food 5-6 times in the last 4 months. They are also in close proximity to where I work. Here are the reasons why I think they deserve 2 stars:

1. To get the 'free chow mein over $20', your total order must be over $20 BEFORE taxes. This seems to be a real issue for them and they were relentless when I was $.38 off.
2. Their vegetable freshness is inconsistent: I had the fish fillet with asparagus dish and the asparagus tasted like it had been previously cooked, frozen, then reheated. Who serves THAT at a restaurant?!
3. They don't give receipts and demand that you pay the correct amount of taxes.
4.Their eggrolls are disgusting! They flavor them with a strange pork lard/blood mixture.
5. Any entree with rice or noodles ALWAYS has 3/5 portioned rice/noodles to 2/5 meat/veggies.
6. Everything has a bad aftertaste. They must add MSG to everything, because it all tastes the same!
7. The person who answers the phone is rude and hangs up on you before confirming orders.

Hope you have a better experience than I did.
author: Jj H.

description: I don't mind the non authentic aspect. I just love love love their seafood over rice plate. My breath is horrifying afterwards but the pleasure is worth it. I don't live in the area so I'm not sure if there's a cop station nearby but there seems to always be hungry cops coming in every time I come here for a bite. This place is not glamorous but I consistently enjoy their cheap tasty grub.
author: Caroline N.

description: Right in the corner of ghetto and fabulous.  Didn't expect the nice service but it was more than amusing to see Chinese people smile!  We were instantly greeted with a menu and some house tea.  Ordered the dinner for 2 which came with appetizer, soup or salad 2 main courses and of course fried rice or chow mein.  ALL FOR 12.50 per person!  Dont mind if I do!!! Was I expecting a delicious dish with mouth watering food? No but I certainly got it!!
author: James V.

description:
This place is cheap, quick and the servings are plentiful. The egg rolls had too much pepper but everything else was great, at least for me. But the woman who served was HI-larious. I hope we get her again.

But just so you know, I've never been big on Chinese food. If I can get in and out without feeling totally disgusted, it's a successful meal.
author: Alexis B.

description: If you are one of those customers that expect excellent service when you pay less than $10 for a full plate of food go someplace else. This place is on it for the price and food. They serve an excellent dry fried calamari with garlic and jalapenos and have lunch specials. This is my go-to Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: A M.

description:
These guys have a problem answering the phone.  Then they out the phone down and ignored me for awhile.  

I got their menu on my car, so I assume they wanted me to call.  But I'm not likely to try again.  I didn't realize Monday night was so busy.
author: Steve S.

description: Use to really like this place. Had great food flavor, Up until I found a HAIR in my soup. Aside from that being disgusting, The way they handled the situation was worse than the hair! (kinda) The woman thought I was joking about the hair, She was smiling the whole time. Then when she finally found it, Told her I wasnt paying for the soup, She had the nerve to ask me to pay for the steamed rice that I got on the side! RUDE! Other times I have been there they are extremly rude, they yell, they roll their eyes and they just have NO customer service skills!
author: Dee L.

description:
I just love this place. For awhile there I was here at least  two times a week. I have my favorite dishes and I rarely stray:

Kung Pao Tofu!
Broccoli in Oyster Sauce!
Black Bean Tofu!

Ok, so I haven't had any meat here. But if you eat tofu, this is the place because it's big honking pieces; crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

I also can't say enough about the service here. It's a very casual place and family run. The ladies there are very nice, that they remember me. I love that.  You also get your food so fast, and it's really hot (temperature wise)

Thank you nice ladies for always feeding me yummy tofu.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Teddybear ordered dinner...its music to my ear when one mentions salted fish...but he meant rice...its okay...he is a foodie (construction man's stomach) so i trust his jusdgement to oder our to-go dinner and I guess the other order was HK style chow mein. 

Its chinese food, its cheap and were hungry...what do you expect...we devoured the food...enough said.

Ive tasted better but for a dive this is not bad.
author: Malou C.

description:
I have been to Jade Cafe several times since I didn't want to eat the 
$1.50 hot dog and drink at 10th street Costco. The restaurants is pretty
ordinary Chinese food with a cheap price , $5-$7 dollar dishes or rice plates, the rice plates are served all day. We had the beef stew over rice it was very good, the chow fun is pretty average and the lemon chicken
is average. I do notice a lot of employees go here , must be from Costco,the shopping center across the street and General hospital. food 3.5) portion4)  taste4) service4) (Mr Peabody system) will go back again cant be the price and parking.
author: Howard J.

description:
I ordered their Hong Kong Style beef pan friend noodles which was average in taste and large in quantity.  The sauce seemed darker than I was used to and it had a saltier taste than normal. 

The food here is decent for the price you pay and service is usually fast during lunch considering the volume of people that visit this place.  The restaurant itself is not pleasing to the eye and there is no level of ambiance to this place.  It is what it is, Chinese food and nothing more.  This place is designed for a quick meal, not the type of place you'd take a date to.
author: R B.

description:
This is the last min place when the other resturants are not open.
It is fast and cheap but you get what you pay for.  First time experience was a take out order and the person on the phone is rude and the portion was small and the taste is a hit and miss.  They can do decent chow fun but the pan fry HK syle have an odd sauce on it.  I have decided this place is not going to be my regular hang out.
Wonton is not the best,  its home made but small and not even close to what I can make. They have a weak soup base and lack flavor.
Then again I was hungry and in a hurry I have to find something to eat and here I am stuck in Protrero.
Dinning in house is much better, they might even give you free soup.  Most customers are not chinese and they order chow mein and fry rice.   The portion is much bigger then the take out.  The parking is not bad next to the mini mall, spacious area not bad to take the kids.
author: Lantz G.

description:
Unlike every other Chinese restaurant I've ever been to, I've never had anything bad here. In fact, I've stop trying to find it, and at least once a week I'm back for thier Kun Pao tofu and rice plate. That and a Coke for $6.00 is usually the highlight of my lunch-week. They'll even give you a bowl of soup and pot of tea while you wait.
The place is crowded during lunch-time, so unless you want to sit with strangers, which they will gladly try to push you into, show up late or early.
If you go enough, they'll remember you, and lunch usually includes a little bit of friendly chit chat.
When it's slow you'll find staff members folding won ton or de-stringing snow peas on the back table. Yes, it's certainly not a formal place, but you'll find good food at a good value.
author: Jason D.

description:
I haven't found all that many restaurants that will give you choices on what you get in your won ton soup, so I have to say that Jade Cafe gets a star just for having a whole section on its menu dedicated to won ton soup.

I have only received delivery from this place, but it's always hot when it gets here and the delivery guy is UNBELIEVABLY friendly. He always calls me "sister" even though I'm not Asian like him. I like that in a delivery guy, I do. 

The chicken is a little on the fatty side but otherwise good, and the wontons are delightful. When you order fried rice, you get an ENTIRE TRAY of it. We're talking entree size times two. For the price, this place almost can't be beat.
author: Kat E.

description: The food here is good. Depending on who your server is it's hit or miss. The one gal who is our regular server is quite good as she remembers my special requests (not too much sauce,etc.).
author: John S.

description:
Every time I go here, this place just gets better...

Tonight we ordered more food than any two people should ever consume...to the point that the waitress even laughed...

Everything was amazing
Hot & Sour soup was the best I've ever had
Salt & Pepper shrimp was to die for (as always)
Sweet & sour chicken, which I normally don't do...was great
even the steamed rice kicked booty

The daughter of one of the employees was cruising around the joint (she's like 6 or 7 years old) and made our night...she was chatting with us and asking all kinds of questions about our tattoos.  It was hilarious...her parents weren't too happy...no 7 year old girl should ask their parents for tattoos...
author: Matt V.

description:
I had food delivered from here and I did not like it.  The egg rolls were lousy tasting and had a funny taste like the oil was not fresh.  I ordered the pan fried noodles with seafood.  This dish was dry, there was no sauce or any kind of liquid; just noodles, vegetables and fish.  There also appeared to have some type of fake fish in it.  I will not order from here again.  There are too many good Chinese restaurants in the city.  

B.
author: Bernie B.

description:
This is not a four star place in the same way you'd say a hotel is a "four star hotel."  I rated this four stars because of a combination of factors: the staff is super-friendly and accommodating (they're willing to modify the dish), the food is inexpensive (it's nice not to have every lunch be over ten dollars) and yes the food is good.  The decor is nothing special, for sure, but I don't always want to pay for fancy styling which is usually designed to make a place purposely loud.

Went with five other co-workers for lunch and everyone was satisfied with their dish.  I particularly recommend the orange chicken.

I use to go to Jade Cafe #1 on Geary when I used to work near there.  Also very good.
author: Hector O.

description:
This place is near my work and for cheap Chinese food it is okay.  It's not great but it's not bad.  

Okay Food & Cheap
author: Chris L.

description:
I'm addicted to this place.  Very friendly and speedy delivery service that usually arrives at my place in under 25 minutes.  I highly recommend the Roasted Duck Wonton Soup, Chicken with Salted Fish Fried Rice, Ma Po Dofu (Spicy Hot Bean Curd with minced pork)...well, pretty much everything that I've tried.

I've heard that the actual establishment is pretty disgusting, so delivery is recommended.
author: Will H.

description:
I work near here and it is definitely one of my lunchtime favorites! Dining in for some reason tastes much better than taking it to go, but still worth it. The wait staff is quick and attentive. One waitress we call Mama (not sure of her real name) is the best! She always gives us little extras and knows just how we like our food. 
Not to mention the price! I usually get the BBQ pork with tender greens with rice and soup and my meal is under $7! And I always have enough to take leftovers back to the office. 
I hope this place stays around for a long time for my enjoyment
author: Priya P.

description:
The food is only ok, and I've had cheaper Chinese food. The staff there are rude. They want to take your order and have you move out of their way.

I only go there for convenience since I work a block away.
author: Gina P.

description: Average Chinese food, but totally affordable, the rice plates average $5.25 to $7.  I like their veggie spring rolls, nice size and they were crunchy still when they arrived.  Delivery of large food orders is hit or miss so be sure to check your food before the delivery guy leaves.  Had an $80 lunch order and 3 boxes of rice were missing.  After calling the restaurant back they said they would send him back, he was back in 45 minutes.
author: Emy B.

description: Awesome Chinese delivery - truly. I ordered shrimp with black bean sauce and broccoli (Not on the menu/I made it up/no questions asked). The broc was fresh and there were no filler veggies (peppers/onions/celery/carrots). The sauce wasn't too oily or salty. Also great was the egg flower soup - ordered per Yelp - tasty and hot! The pot stickers weren't awesome, but fine. I wish they came with that sweet sauce pot stickers sometimes come with. The delivery came fast. Food for 3 was $20.
author: Andrew K.

description: Very tasty chinnese food. Love the sesame chicken and orange chicken... My wife loves this place so much
author: Rene C.

description: The food was okay, the price was pretty good. There were two of us and we got one of the family meals for two. It was a ridiculous amount of food. The service, however, will ensure that I don't return. It wasn't bad service, it was just rude.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
If you feel like good, solid, cheap Chinese food, and if you're in the area, this is definitely a place to consider.  The minced beef soup was okay, the walnut prawns and salt and pepper pork chops were definitely very tasty.  and good sized portions too!

The waitress gave us great service, refilling water frequently, helped us pack up the leftovers, etc.  Probably it was just because my friend and I are both very cute.  Yea, that must be it.
author: John R.

description:
There's a lot of white people here so it must be good, right?

As the only good Chinese place in Potrero Hill, the place is poppin at lunch time.  Nights, I have no clue.  

I was a customer of Jade Cafe Geary 2005-2006 and Potrero Hill since 2006, because they were conveniently near my jobs.  I chose Geary in the first place because they had the best Broccoli Beef in the region, a dish which I use to gauge all Chinese lunch spots.  I ended up going back to Geary repeatedly because they make what I can't.

The other dish which is very well done is the tomato beef chow mein (or jeen mein/crispy noodle).  it USED to be a sopping sweet & sour noodle dish WITH tomato chunks, which is utterly annoying for someone who knows how to cook tomato beef, but they've changed the recipe to be a very good tomato dish.  Very good flavor that I can't replicate.

The only thing they lack is a peking spareribs dish, which is kind of hard to make well.  If you taste ketchup, get the hell out of there man cmon.  

I don't bother ordering duck, because of the skimps.  There's NEVER a good portion of duck on a RICE dish!  kiddding me? novice or something...  Even noodle dishes are like that, and that's only my exp with Chinese lunch places.  GO BUY A POUND from the markets on Stockton/Sac and microwave it at home.  so much more worth it.  

yes I'm Chinese, but I'm not the harshest critic.  I'll eat most anything if I'm impressed, lazy, or clueless as to how they got it to taste so damn good.  "no msg?  You sure?? hmm... [skeptically stuffs face]" 

But I only have a rotating menu of 4 dishes, so what do i know?

Best place for a Chinese rice/noodle lunch in PH and Montgomery, until schooled otherwise...
author: Waylan C.

description: We like the food and great service. We always go on Friday night. Yummy,yummy, the food and service better than another one on Geary st.
author: Ipohgirl T.

description:
Compared to Mikados next door this place is "OK".  The service is what you expect from a chinese place... fast paced order now pay now hang up kind of deal.  That's okay because their food is good and priced well.  Although it sometimes gives me a stomach ache when I eat too much.

One time me and my co-worker ordered some food to go and the price came out to be $34.50 and if you ever seen Russel Peters you would understand how awesome that is haha.
author: rocky b.

description: Cheap food with a cheap taste.  Sorry, I'll pass next time.
author: Ricky M.

description:
I'd have given them a better review (we ordered from them tonight), but last time we ate in, it was pretty F'd up. I order the same thing every time-Asian food is my one chance to get the only meat I eat-shrimp. Call it justification if you like, I call them insects. 

So, given that I gave up everything else meatish years ago, I know I did not order the wrong thing. I got chicken chow fun. I will not eat this and asked her to get me what I ordered (politely as always). Three minutes later, I got it back with shrimp. Yes, I was suspicious, but what do I know about line speed? 

It had shrimp, certainly, but on closer inspection, contained dozens of chicken particles and even quite large chunks. Kind of sick. I'd rather have waited and taken home what I could not consume, had my partner been impatient. 

The main question-what if I'd ordered the chicken because I was allergic to shrimp? 

I'd recommend this place if you're on a budget and have no allergies. Nothing I've had there is too greasy, and it's four blocks away, so I give them another chance, but check it, 'cause that substitution was wak (and we paid for it, anyway). 

Maybe politeness is the wrong approach, in some cases. That is, unless you hope to return.
author: dodie L.

description:
i liked it better when it actually looked like a hole in the wall. Now they've repainted and look a notch more decent bleh!

Whenever i'm in this part of town and need some eats Jade cafe is one of the places i'll visit. It's the typical chinese place with greasy bathroom floors and waitresses screaming orders to the kitchen. Oh wait they don't scream anymore, they've updated remember?

Food is tasty, fresh and filling. Lunch specials are screaming deals. But i over-order just to pack leftovers for the next days lunch. 

I think this place never got in touch with other chinese restaurants because some items are named silly. I don't know why they call it Rainbow chicken (in s.f. why not), it's General Tso's (Zhao, Zao, Tzo, etc.) Chicken is my favorite. Followed by Peking Spicy Beef (aka Beef with Black pepper sauce). Spicy Eggplant with Chicken and Shrimp is good too!

Parking is decent but the area is kinda skuzzy. 

Best feat from Jade Cafe was i ordered 10 items, they told me that they'd be ready in 10 minutes. Went to Safeway for a 1/2 gallon of vanilla ice cream and came back 10minutes later with 2 boxes (cardboard, not the Styrofoam the food is in) of food ready to go. Daaang..

i feel bad for the delivery guy though. He needs to see a chiropractor.. *Worried*
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
Does anyone remember New World Chinese restaurant on Clement Street? OMG, that was the best chinese restaurant in SF in the 80's. There was never a bad dish. Sadly, it closed and I have not had anything close to the quality of food and service that I experienced at New World. Most of the szechwan and mandarin restaurants that I try 
just flat out pour the sugar into the sauces and it makes me angry. If  I wanted dessert then I would order dessert. Sorry, I digress into a rant
and that is not the point here. Jade Cafe #2 was just fine. I ordered 
Beef with tender greens over rice lunch special and guess what, no
sugar. My husband ordered Kung Pao chicken lunch special and guess what, no sugar! The dishes weren't the greatest but we had 
lunch specials and a beer each. Total with tip 20.50. Service was 
friendly and top notch. What happened to New World?! Does anyone
know?
author: Cindy J.

description:
I eat here virtually every week. Now if you work in this neighborhood [No, I am not a hooker] it's not like you can weigh options between Zuni Cafe and Hayes Street Grill. For Crissakes, across the street is the Double Play which is fine for getting lit, but food choices are limited unless you go into the Mission.

So this is a review for folks who happen to be in this area. Why you would drive to an area where hookers and homeless people hang, I'm not sure. Your call. But with choices like Eliza's up on Potrero to drive to, I wouldn't suggest you do any back flips to get here.

But I like the Jade. I give Two Strong Stars. Interior decorating is not a strength. The bathroom has issues. But the staff is friendly, the food is freshly prepared, the Shrimp and Bok Choy [called "Tender Greens" on the menu] is solid, the prices are cheap, and it's fast. The place is packed at lunch time with loyal regulars.

I don't want to hear this "only white people go here" song and dance. I have been here 80 times, and that's horse shit. Its solid. No head fakes. Nothing fancy. But just fine.
author: Jeff W.

description:
first off the place doesnt have any special "ora" about it what so ever, and the fish tank is a bit on the grimy side. but other than that it's just the plain ol' regular chinese restaurant you might find anywhere else. i found the staff to be pretty friendly though. all smiles and very quick on the draw. i was in and out in under 45 minutes and considering that i got the spare ribs i found that to be quite pleasant. the menu is pretty large and can satisfy everything from the most diehard of vegetarians to the gnarliest of carnivours. 

now of course one could take a step back and say "you do know that there is better chinese food in san francisco right?". my answer to that is most certainly yes, but for the price and the service, not to mention its location, i'd say there's no reason why one wouldn't mess with the jade cafe if in the mission/portrero/soma area. it has always fit my lunch/dinner-time needs.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Oh, dear.

For some reason, the office decided to come here for lunch. It was a sunny day, we walked down from Potrero Hill, getting further from our kind, delicious, standby lunch spots with every step.

We were seated promptly. Everything was a little scummy. My boss asked like 14 times for chopsticks. When I tried to order some steamed bean curd, the waitress told me I should get Kung Pao Tofu, if I liked tofu. Uh, I wanted some steamed bean curd! WTF? But I never stand up for myself at restaurants, so fine, Kung Pao Tofu for me.

My coworker needed to order something soft because she just had her wisdom teeth taken out, so KPT was not going to work for her. There was a big ordeal when she tried to order something else. Eventually she got some soft vegetables in sauce. Mmmm.

The food was not very good, even for cheap, greasy Chinese, but, inexplicably, there were sure a lot of people in there.

I will not be back, and I really wouldn't recommend it. Sorry, Jade Cafe.
author: Megan D.

description:
I ordered from this restaurant strictly because of the rave reviews i read from city search. Um, no. 

"No" SO MUCH that I decided to create a YELP account strictly to steer other sheep away from this Place !!!  How bad are you that it drives me to take the time to create an entire on line profile to complain about you?  

I ordered the walnut prawns and the kung pao chicken (extra hot). Both of these dishes were specifically recommended. When i got them, they were terrible. The walnut prawns were tasteless and soggy. The kung pao chicken was supposed to spicy and was definitely not at all. It was over-sauced so much, the chicken tasted like the peanuts, like the carrots, like the zucchini.....all tasted like soy sauce..... 

I will cut  city searchers some slack. Maybe this is your first Chinese food experience ever? Maybe you are deathly ill and can't taste, or smell, or have blurry vision ?! Maybe you are used to eating at Chain Chinese Food Establishments like: Pick Up Sticks, or I Love Teriyaki......Or possibly you are co-owner of Jade Cafe and really need to promote your business. 

3 (Good) things about Jade (I am not a total bee-och)- Fast delivery, friendly and professional delivery driver and found our apartment which is not easy.... 

Pros: Fast Deliver, Friendly Deliver Driver, Found our Apartment which is not easy.... 
Cons: Terrible Quality of Food, Over Sauced, and OVER salty, Put us on hold six times when trying to order delivery.
author: Rachel G.

description: Food is very good! Decent Price! Service is ok but could definitely could be friendlier.
author: D A.

description: I work a block away and have given this restaurant a few tries. Each time the service has been as bad as the food. It looks like sisters own the place and each one of them are as mean as the next. They don't crack a smile and they don't say "thank you". Maybe because each time I've gone its for pick up, but my money is still green. Onto to the disgusting food, it's always been overly greasy and just plain salty. They need to lay off the MSG and try putting real flavor into their food. YUCK!
author: Freckles H.

description: Decent, cheap chinese food.  Servers/service is a little short/sharp.
author: B c.

description: It always be one of our choice for Friday night take-out. You can order it on Seamless , even though their forgot to prepare our order twice that we had to wait for 15 min. Food is good if you consider the price. Personally, I think the beef stew rice plate is the best, my little one can gobble a bowl of rice mixed with the beef gravy. We also had their family dinner set, the portion is huge. We even had leftover for the next day.
author: Jessica H.

description: My co-worker took me here a few weeks back in thanks for painting his bathroom, and it was quite lovely.  They serve you tea and soup while you wait and the food was quite good and reasonably affordable.  I ordered their beef chow fun with black bean sauce and was so hungry I wolfed down an entire plate.  Very yummy.  I only give three stars because I am not in the area and have my own local spot when I want fast Chinese food, but I assure you if I lived by here it would be my emergency to-go food place. This place is also endeared to me, because several years ago when I was very young I had roast duck for the first time here and I recall it being tasty as well.  Stop here after a long day of shopping at Sports Basement or that little mall-let across the street!
author: Jane D.

description: The rainbow chicken is to die for! One plate feeds both my husband and I! 7.00 for a meal for two people? Can't beat it! :)
author: Chelsey S.

description: The food is ok, but not outstanding, though pretty salty and overcooked.  However, I will never, ever go there again since they plastered my car with a menu.  Now my neighborhood street has their menus all over it when people ripped them off their cars.  Sorry, spam me like this, mess up my neighborhood and you lose my business forever.  I encourage other people to not visit companies that advertise in this illegal and invasive way.
author: William F.

description: I go for lunch 3 times a month and its always the same. Cheap and good. The lady that serves us is so nice and always asks how my family is doing. Yes it can be greasy, but what ever. I did ask them to turn the radio down one time and they did. And they recooked my food since it was just warm one time. They are very busy at lunch so be ready to wait.
author: krispy k.

description: And now for the long-overdue final installment in my Potrero Center trilogy.  I was probably looking forward to Jade Cafe the least, but I was pleasantly surprised.  The Kung Pao Tofu truly is a marvel of budget dining--large, hot, cheap, yet still cooked like they mean it.  This puts them in at least the same league as other, closer lunch spots like Chow's or Fanny's.  But then, maybe I'll wait to come back until the P-Center has been transformed into the mixed-use TOD it so desperately ought to be (yeah, it's a long wait, but I'll manage).
author: Wes M.

description: The food here is alright, though a little greasy for my taste. On the plus side, it's pretty cheap and they deliver! And, if you order at least $20 worth of food, you get a free chicken chow mien or pork fried rice! They told me it would be 1 hour for delivery, but they arrived in 30 minutes. It's good for those days when I just can't muster up the energy to cook dinner... or care about eating healthy.
author: Bridgette A.

description: Chinese food is good, simple and cheap.   That is basically what this place is.  Not stellar, but for $6 it ain't bad.  Food was tasty, if a bit heavy (the ole' bowling-ball-in-stomach feeling set in after lunch).  Best part was the service.  The waitress noticed me eyeing my friends chow fun in duck sauce and offered to have my chow mien brought back to the kitchen for a little duck sauce.  Awesome.
author: Eric M.

description: Typical cheap  and greasy chinese food except with a weird waiter who insists on commenting on whatever I'm reading in the Chronicle while trying to enjoy my lunch
author: Bumble B.

description: The food is very YUMMY....but the girls who work there at the counter bagging the to-go orders are very RUDE....not very nice...good cheap chinese food but bad customer service at this location. The one on Geary downtown, the people there seem nicer. I was there one day and met the owner, she was SO NICE! I wish all her employees would be like her :)
author: v v.

description: Pretty standard chinese take-out.  Fast and cheap.  Now only if their staff were just a micron more friendly.
author: Sean M.

description: Better than expected. It's not exactly luring you in with it's charm and good looks. But...pretty solid hot and sour soup and potstickers. Not too greasy and the soup was really flavorful. One tip - don't leave the to-go bag in your car for too long...that stuff is Fragrant with a capital "F".
author: Kate S.

description:
I went here for the first time this afternoon and had some extremely mixed emotions about everything.

I had been told for 3 days straight that everyone in my building was telling me (the new girl) that I HAVE to go to the Chinese restaurant up the street.

"Well how good is it?"
"It's so good, I live in the Sunset and come all the way over here on my days off just to get the broccoli beef"

Well damn, with a review like that how can I say no!

So I get an hour lunch break.  The restaurant is especially busy so i can understand if there wasn't enough of the staff there to tend to everyone, but I was completely ignored for a good 10 minutes before a woman shoved hot tea onto my table and rudely took my order.  I'm still not one to have this place be a one star review in my head only because I feel like I should give them a decent chance at wowing me.  So I am patient and I sip on my tea while the clock is slowly ticking away on my lunch hour.

My food arrives hot and fast which was a nice change from the silence I was subjected to at the beginning of my meal.  I thought the rice smelled a little funny but my eyes opened wide at the sight of the plate that was set in front of me.  The colors were vibrant and the food looked fresh and crisp. I couldn't wait to get my hands on one of my sweet and sour chicken pieces. Glistening Chinese ecstasy enveloped my taste buds as I crunched down on the crispy chicken pieces. It finally had been done.  I had finally found the most unforgettable sweet and sour chicken in the city.  I was hooked and the service I received slowly became a mere memory until I actually sat down to write this review.  

All in all, I gave the place 3 stars and that was based on the entire experience.  I mean, I could figure out a way to make extra crispy chicken pieces covered in homemade sweet and sour sauce, but I go out because its convenient and I am paying someone to serve me the goods.  If I could base this review strictly on the food it would get a 5 star rating hands down, but unfortunately for me I believe good service is at least worth 2 stars of a 5 star review, Sorry Jade!  Maybe next time I'll just have to learn that I will order in advance and take it back to my desk where I can enjoy a fully uninterrupted foodgasm in the privacy of my own cubicle instead of in a place where its going to cost me extra for service.  Seriously? 
Otherwise my meal would have only cost me $6.50.  It comes on a giant dinner plate and I came nowhere near finishing it all.  You get a good portion of some bomb ass take out...just don't eat there and you'll be golden. Seriously..don't...it was in my fortune cookie...
author: Sarah L.

description:
It's really is a Blue Collar place, the foods the last time I ordered from here it was OK now it's just plain nasty!!!!   I have to take back the stars I gave them!
I've been there 3 times and once left irritated with the rude workers and poor service!   I've ordered a few times for delivery usually the person on the phone is more pleasant but today I might as well have been in the actual restaurant!  
I will not be returning to nor ordering from #2 Jade Cafe on Bryant! YUCK!
author: Lisa D.

description: Reasonable prices, decent food, quick service make Jade a 3 star.....
author: Mia T.

description: I stopped in here for dinner one Sunday night. I'd been in the mood for Vietnamese but all my local Vietnamese places were closed. I had the egg rolls and BBQ duck won ton soup. The service was slow and confused and the food lacked flavor. Nothing I had was bad but nothing was impressive. There are plenty of better restaurants in the cheap-Chinese genre, even in the Mission.
author: Ian M.

description: Average Chinese food.  Not a bad price either.  Really decent!!!  We ordered take out for work and within 15 minutes the food was ready and picked up.  They are quick and efficient plus the place was filled with people out on their lunch break.  I had the Mango Chicken - a tad spicy, the chicken was good, and the sauce was yummy over rice!  I'll be back.
author: Kaitlyn G.

description:
a few years back, while  waiting for a show at bottom of the hill to start, my friends and i went to get some grub and ended up at jade cafe #2.

i ordered the spring rolls, which weren't too bad, until i bit down on something hard.  i spit out a few pieces of twisted METAL!!!!  i looked at the rest of my uneaten spring roll, and there was another, longer piece sticking out.

i called the waitress over, and put the chards of metal and half eaten food in her hand... and all she did was bring us our bill so we could get the hell out!  and she still made me pay!

hopefully the was just a one time thing, but never again!
author: Cady C.

description: Decent food at a very affordable price. Love the rainbow chicken! Just dont order for delivery the food shows up cold and greasy had to drive all the way back there and return it.
author: Michael W.

description:
i came into work hungover every single day this week.

(! happy holidays !)  

when im hungover, i am a bottomless pit.  and bottomless pit wants noodles.  soupy carby big fat rice noodles.  ho-fun-alicious noodles.

my initial thought was mission hunan chinese.  i have had their noodles before and it was decent.  good comfort food.  but the thought of walking those 3 looooooooooong blocks made my head hurt.  i want ho fun and i want it now.  so i walked up a block to jade cafe #2.

service was eh, but who cares about that when a big honking bowl of noodle soup is dominating your every thought.  im used to the indifferent service of chinese restaurants anyway.

my veggie ho fun noodle soup came.  it was very... blah.  a blah veggie noodle soup is just down right preposterous.  all it takes is just noodles, a decent soup base, and some decent veggies!   

well.  this blah veggie noodle soup had a handful of blah stir fry vegetables.  2 florets of broccoli, some small pieces of onion, bell pepper, carrots.  a very sad vegetable assortment indeed. 

it also featured a very bland soup base, i suspect its just water and probably lots of msg because my tongue is tingling with the msg effect right now.  (just use chicken broth!  chicken broth makes everything taste good, damn it!)  it had a film of oil and was so greasy that in the end i just ate the plain ol noodles.

sigh, it was so disappointing.  halfway through the bowl i actually contemplated not finishing it.  but alas, the bottomless pit won and i finished the bowl, sadder and angrier with each tasteless worthless bite.

i paid and opened my fortune cookie.

"today is a good day to be spontaneous!"

so i walked down to mission hunan and got bowl #2.  

i am a fatass.

(! happy holidays !)
author: Helen L.

description: The Tofu with Green Bean in Dry Spicy Garlic Sauce is excellent.  Good place to pick up dinner on the way home from work.
author: Wan T.

description: Consistent food, service is friendly. The garlic eggplant is a favorite- a bit greasy but just drain it off. They delivered within an hour of ordering on a Friday night which was great.
author: Jay F.

description: Excellent, fresh, and dirt cheap Chinese food. I especially love their homemade egg rolls and potstickers. Friendly service.
author: L S.

description: For cheap, tasty Chinese food that delivers, you could do far worse. Really, three-star taste, but when you throw in the price/amount/delivery factor its a strong four stars!
author: Johnny O.

description: I went to Jade Cafe #2 based on a recommendation.  I was told that Jade Cafe is a good lunch spot for "good and cheap" Chinese food.  The cheap part I agree with but the good part is a stretch.  The food is inexpensive and the service is fast which usually makes for a good lunch experience but the missing ingredient was good food.  The food wasn't bad but just really generic.  If I am going to eat heavy Chinese food, it has to be good otherwise I rather just pop a lean cuisine in the microwave at the office.
author: Josh K.

description: Well its not the best Chinese restaurant, its really not a typical Chinese restaurant by rice plates and they will let you customize is not bad for the price you pay.  How did I explain this to a friend - its quick, its Chinese and its decent!
author: May A.

description: If what you are looking for is quick Chinese food for a decent price for either delivery or take out then you have found your place. I wouldn't take a date here or eat here if you do not plan on smelling like Chinese food when you leave however for the price and the quick turn around then this gets a good rating. The service is so/so if you are eating here however if you are picking it up and running out with the food then what you need is right here.
author: Bobby B.

description:
For a "restaurant" that has single handedly littered almost every neighborhood in SF with its stupid green flyers, they sure have'nt gotten the memo about cleanliness standards and customer service. Jade cafe has a very scummy vibe and really hasn't updated it's look in all of the years its been open. Lets give it one star for being authenticaly a dive with dirty walls and floors and pictures that hang at an angle off the wall, tilting forward such that they look like they are ready to fall on your head.
The clientel are typically working class and people who don't look like they are critical of the cuisine. I guess I'm a snob. I like to enter a restaurant and not be treated like a criminal. From the moment I entered this dump, the ladies that take the orders were staring at me like I was lower class then the food they serve. When my order was ready, the waitress handed my food to me from an extended arm while looking away from me. Kind of like when you hand a bag of dog shit to someone you are disusted with. I interpreted it as Tattoo prejudice as I sometimes get the riff raff treatment from asian food establishments.
I ordered the green beans and fried tofu which is bathed in garlic and MSG. What followed my meal was two trips the bathroom, stomach cramps, heart palpatations and dizziness. Jade was the color my skin turned after eating here. If you enjoy the smell of bleach while you eat....don't hesitate to dine here.
author: Go Cat Go G.

description:
I went here for a late lunch last week. Wasn't too busy, but it was around 2pm. I guess you just kinda seat yourselves, and the waitresses will get to you. It's a definite dive, not that clean with mismatching dishes. But the prices are quite affordable, and the food portions are pretty sizable. I usually get the fried squid with spicy salt...a little heat from the jalepeno, a little crunch from the fried batter. I have tried other items from the menu like black bean fish (unmemorable, bland). 

Don't actively seek this place out; I would only recommend it if you are in the area regularly and have to choose from the limited dining scene.
author: Andrew C.

description: I went to lunch here today, and had my worst Chinese food experience in a long time.  Considering it was lunchtime in the city, the service was not so bad...it was actually fast.  The problem for me was in the food.  While their soups are quite good, I ordered chow mein today that was more grease than noodle.  If you don't mind eating extremely greasy food, then this place is right for you. - you definitely get what you're paying for...
author: Jessica B.

description: Generic cheap chinese food.  Large portions. If you're hungry, on a budget, or work near here, it's not bad.  Otherwise I see no reason to eat here.
author: Avi H.

description: I thought the food here was pretty greasy....the price was cheap but service was pretty fast.  The only thing I ordered from here was the Wonton Soup with Chicken and I thought that was pretty tasty!
author: JenJen W.

description: good food, was recommended by co workers, and indeed is a good place to eat. except the employees who have bad attitude. this lady that stays behind the counter, writing the checks and answering the phone.  sorry but after that incident where she gave me attitude, i am not going back.
author: Julio C.

description: I go here for lunch sometimes. Its good Chinese comfort food and reasonable prices ($5-6). They give you a lot and its quite tasty.
author: Roger C.

description: I love this place.  Where else can you get 3000 calories worth of homemade Kung Pao Tofu for $4.50?
author: Amy S.

description: the food is plentiful, inexpensive, and ok.  the service is hit and miss and don't try and go 30 minutes before closing because you get the bums rush, complete with chairs stack on top all the tables, except yours, etc.  but the place is not clean.  the entire white pepper shaker i used was very sticky and the backs of the aqua colored seats almost made me lose my appetite, they are so grimy.
author: caveat e.

description: This place is pleasant.  I have been coming here for years and sometimes on semi-special occasions, and during my lunch break.  The food is good, tasty, and the prices are affordable.  I always get seating quick and fast service.  I have many memories of this place when I come here, sometimes I wake at night thinking about lunch tomorrow, I don't know why.  Located right on Bryant and 16th Streets,  the 22 Fillmore bus will take you right there.  Decent food at good prices = good review.
author: Bryant K.

description:
their food is ok, price is fair, other than these, nothing good.
the worst thing is their faces, the fat viet boss looks @ you just like you murdered her parents and destroyed her family!
author: Jex H.

description: I used to liked Chinese food, until the day that I went with my friends to eat to the jade's cofe restaurant, where we ordered four orders of chicken brocoli and two of chicken fried rice. The food was undercook, but it  became disgusting when we saw a cockroach coming out from under the table. the worts part was when we noticed that it was also a dead cockroach in  one of our dishes. i sincerely  recommend you to pay a little more money when you go to eat. its always better to spend a little more money and have a nice time, instead of having a horrible experience. Jade's cofe restaurant is the worts place that i have ever been in my entire life. ITS DISGUSTING AND NASTY AS HELL :/
author: fischer t.

description: I was craving Chinese food while at work the other day and decided to check out Jade cafe across the street from me. You know that feeling when food absolutely satisfies what you crave? Thank you Jade Cafe. 5.75 for an enormous portion of chicken chow mein. I'll definitely be a regular there.
author: Chris P.

description: Wow...amazing delivery service , when I notified them that  the single can of soda I ordered did not arrive; they sent the delivery guy back with two cans   ! what a great thing  to do..and the food was hot & fresh and tasty as ever. !
author: Barry C.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!  That's the best way to describe this place.  The food wasn't horrible, but I have had better elsewhere.  Some of the dishes lacked flavor.  It took a total of 15 minutes of just sitting there before we finally asked for the check.  It took two tries before they gave us boxes.  I will never go here again!
author: Kim C.

description: we had ordered from th is place 12/17 f/11 and spent $31 for family of 4. the food was skimpy:shrimp fried rice and beef br occoli. the beef broccoli tasted mushy and bland, the fried chicken wasn't seasoned. the only items that was good: shrimp fried rice and pot stickers. i've been to chinese food places that give u big portions for your money's worth.i just wanted to check this place out and give it a chance but not going to be on my list of favorite.
author: Bernadette F.

description: this place is ok. the people who work here are kind of rude and pushy. they took forever to make our food that we ordered to go, and i'm generally a patient person. i guess i didn't like the feeling i got that i was being punished for asking questions about the food. (their answers were gruff, like i was bothering them..) the food isn't that great, very greasy and the orange chicken isn't as good as other places i've tried. however, since this place is close to my house i still go there when i'm having a chinese craving. after my last experience though, i don't think i'll go again, unless its a dire emergency. the food took forever, was pretty cold by the time we got it, and i just don't like it when people who are getting my business aren't that nice to me.
author: Jo L.

description: decent place for takeout the lady at the counter aka "pig nose" is rude as hell but wtf its only lik 5-7 for lunch
author: d l.

description: they have BAD SERVICE.sushi and chinese?!?! not fresh fish.i tried the Spicy Tuna roll, and the fish smells disgusting.i also tried the chicken with corn soup and it was all water,little chicken and a lot of corn.the kitchen was very dirty.a lot of msg and oil,when i tried the Rainbow Chicken.they delivery once very bad delivery guy,he asked me for more tips?! their miso soup is just water.they are cheap but not fresh.
author: Tony B.
